Stats Insider has simulated the outcome of Sunday's Houston vs Golden State NBA game 10,000 times, giving the Rockets a 69% chance of beating the Warriors at Toyota Center.
The Houston Rockets will face the Golden State Warriors in NBA action at Toyota Center on Sunday, beginning at 11:00am AEDT.
With star players Jalen Green, Alperen Sengun and Fred VanVleet, the Rockets are looking to overcome a Warriors line-up that includes Jonathan Kuminga, Buddy Hield and Andrew Wiggins.
Injuries for the Warriors include Stephen Curry (day to day with an ankle injury), Andrew Wiggins (day to day with a back injury), and De'Anthony Melton (day to day with a facet injury).
Houston faces Golden State in a matchup of Western Conference teams.
The Rockets are listed as 5-point favourites against the Warriors, with odds of $1.95 available at Bet365.
Stats Insider's predicted final score for Rockets vs Warriors at Toyota Center on Sunday is the Rockets winning 111-105.
Jalen Green is expected to lead the Rockets with 21 points, 5 rebounds and 4 assists, while Jonathan Kuminga is projected to finish with 17 points, 5 rebounds and 3 assists for the Warriors.
The Rockets averaged 114.3 points per game while allowing opponents to score 113.2 last season.
Golden State finished 46-36 overall and 26-26 in Western Conference action during the 2023-24 season.
Houston finished 41-41 overall and 28-24 in Western Conference action last season.
The Warriors averaged 117.8 points per game last season, 15.6 from the free-throw line and 44.4 from 3-point range.
The Warriors allowed a TS% of 51% last season -- 9th-best in the NBA; the Rockets had a TS% of 50% last season -- T-3rd-worst in the NBA.
The Rockets averaged 15.8 fast break points per game last season -- T-7th-highest in the NBA; the Warriors allowed 15.2 fast break points per game last season -- 8th-worst in the NBA.
